items.title: A Boston Restaurant Displayed Whitey Bulger’s Mug Shot. An Uproar Ensued.
items.summary: The owners of Savin Bar & Kitchen have so far rejected requests from residents to remove photos of gangsters who terrorized the city for decades.

items.title: Airlines Told to Disregard Gender- Neutral ‘X’ on U.S. Passports and Add ‘M’ or ‘F’
items.summary: Although passports with an “X” marker remain valid, a new federal rule requires airlines on their internal information system to mark passengers with an “M” or an “F.”

items.title: Other Brazen Art Heists Like the Louvre Jewelry Theft
items.summary: The robbery at the Paris museum on Sunday is only the latest in a long line of breaches.

items.title: Supreme Court Will Weigh Gun Restrictions for Drug Users
items.summary: The Second Amendment case tests a federal law used to convict Hunter Biden that bars drug users and addicts from possessing guns.

items.title: Lawmaker Demands Hearing on U.S. Strikes on Boats in Caribbean
items.summary: Representative Adam Smith said the Trump administration had failed to provide a legal rationale for killing rather than arresting drug trafficking suspects.

items.title: Judge Seeks Answers on Trump Immigration Crackdown in Chicago
items.summary: A federal judge questioned operational leaders of the crackdown on Monday about their tactics and their use of tear gas.

items.title: Trump says China ‘doesn’t want’ to invade Taiwan and reaffirms trust in Xi
items.summary: <p>US president says ‘I want to be good to China’ after Pentagon previously warned China may attempt takeover of Taiwan</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/20/james-comey-donald-trump-charges-shutdown-albanese-politics-live-updates">US politics live – latest updates</a></p></li></ul><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> has expressed doubt on Monday that <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/china">China</a> would invade <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/taiwan">Taiwan</a> as he voiced confidence in his relationship with his Chinese counterpart, <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/xi-jinping">Xi Jinping</a>, whom he will meet later this month.</p><p>Trump was asked about an earlier Pentagon assessment that Xi could <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/mar/10/china-could-invade-taiwan-in-next-six-years-top-us-admiral-warns">in the next six years attempt to seize Taiwan,</a> a self-governing democracy claimed by China.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/20/trump-china-taiwan-invasion-xi-jinping">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump reposts AI-generated video of plane dumping sludge on No Kings protesters
items.summary: <p>President has previously posted deepfake videos and AI images like this one, which JD Vance called ‘funny’</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/20/james-comey-donald-trump-charges-shutdown-albanese-politics-live-updates">US politics live – latest updates</a></p></li></ul><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> reposted an AI-generated video of him flying a fighter plane emblazoned with the words “King Trump” and dumping brown sludge on to protesters, in what appears to be a retort to the widespread <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/20/no-kings-protests-trump-democrats">No Kings protests</a> that took place on Saturday against his second presidency.</p><p>In the video, which the president posted on Saturday night, a sharply orange Trump is seen donning a gold crown and manning a plane monikered “King Trump”. The video zooms away from Trump and shows the plane dumping bursts of brown matter on an AI-generated cityscape. A protester, taking a selfie video, captures the crowd being covered in the brown liquid. The last shot of the 19-second video is of protesters in what appears to be Times Square getting dumped on.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/20/trump-ai-video-no-kings">Continue reading...</a>
